com.teamten.image

Class ImageUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.teamten.image.ImageUtils

  • public class ImageUtils
extends Object
    Assorted utility methods for transforming images.

      Returns the shadow of the input image.

      Saves a list of images as an animated GIF with the specified pause time for each image and whether to loop continuously.

      Returns an image scaled by a particular ratio, where 0.5 means half width and half height.

      Like resizeToFit() but only shrinks.

    • Method Detail

      • makeTransparent

        public static BufferedImage makeTransparent(int width,
                                            int height)
        Create a new image of the given size with all pixels transparent.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the new image in pixels.
        height - height of the new image in pixels.
        Returns:
        a transparent 4-byte ABGR image of the specified size.

      • make

        public static BufferedImage make(int width,
                                 int height,
                                 Color color)
        Create a new image of the given size with a given background color.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the new image in pixels.
        height - height of the new image in pixels.
        color - color to fill the image with.
        Returns:
        a 3-byte BGR or 4-byte ABGR image (spending on the translucency of the color) of the specified size, filled with the specified color.

      • makeWhite

        public static BufferedImage makeWhite(int width,
                                      int height)
        Create a new image of the given size with a white background.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the new image in pixels.
        height - height of the new image in pixels.
        Returns:
        a 3-byte BGR white image of the specified size.

      • makeLinearGradient

        public static BufferedImage makeLinearGradient(int width,
                                               int height,
                                               int beginX,
                                               int beginY,
                                               Color beginColor,
                                               int endX,
                                               int endY,
                                               Color endColor)
        Creates an image of the specified size with a linear gradient going from begin to end, interpolating the specified colors linearly. Pixels past the end of the line are the color of that end.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the new image in pixels.
        height - height of the new image in pixels.
        beginX - X coordinate of the starting gradient location.
        beginY - Y coordinate of the starting gradient location.
        beginColor - color at the starting location. Must be opaque.
        endX - X coordinate of the ending gradient location.
        endY - Y coordinate of the ending gradient location.
        endColor - color at the ending location. Must be opaque.
        Returns:
        a 3-byte BGR image of the specified size with the specified gradient.

      • makeCircularGradient

        public static BufferedImage makeCircularGradient(int width,
                                                 int height,
                                                 int centerX,
                                                 int centerY,
                                                 Color centerColor,
                                                 int edgeX,
                                                 int edgeY,
                                                 Color edgeColor)
        Creates an image of the specified size with a circular gradient going from center to the edge (of the circle), interpolating the specified colors linearly. Pixels past the edge of the circle are the color of the edge.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the new image in pixels.
        height - height of the new image in pixels.
        centerX - X coordinate of the center of the gradient.
        centerY - Y coordinate of the center of the gradient.
        centerColor - color at the center. Must be opaque.
        edgeX - X coordinate of the edge gradient location.
        edgeY - Y coordinate of the edge gradient location.
        edgeColor - color at the edge location. Must be opaque.
        Returns:
        a 3-byte BGR image of the specified size with the specified gradient.

      • createGraphics

        public static Graphics2D createGraphics(BufferedImage image)
        Creates a high-quality graphics objects for this object.
        Parameters:
        image - image to crate graphics context for.
        Returns:
        a graphics context with high quality settings.

      • convertType

        public static BufferedImage convertType(BufferedImage src,
                                        int newType)
        Return the image with a new type.
        Parameters:
        src - image to convert. It is not modified.
        newType - the new image type. See BufferedImage.TYPE_...
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image, but with the new type.

      • getTypeName

        public static String getTypeName(int imageType)
        Returns the name of the image type.
        Parameters:
        imageType - an image type. See BufferedImage.TYPE_...
        Returns:
        a string representing the image type. For example, BufferedImage.TYPE_3BYTE_BGR will return "3BYTE_BGR".

      • getBytesPerPixel

        public static int getBytesPerPixel(BufferedImage image)
        Return the number of bytes per pixel for this image.
        Parameters:
        image - image to analyze.
        Returns:
        either 3 or 4, depending on the type of the image.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the type is not TYPE_3BYTE_BGR or TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR. Do not expand this set without checking all callers, since they may be depending on this restricted set.

      • copy

        public static BufferedImage copy(BufferedImage image)
        Make a copy of the image.
        Parameters:
        image - image to copy.
        Returns:
        a copy of the image, with the same pixels and type.

      • compose

        public static BufferedImage compose(BufferedImage... layers)
        Compose images over one another. The first layer in the array is the lowest one.
        Parameters:
        layers - array of layers, from lowest (obscured) to highest (visible).
        Returns:
        composed 4-byte ABGR image.

      • makeShadow

        public static BufferedImage makeShadow(BufferedImage image,
                                       double radius,
                                       double darkness)
        Returns the shadow of the input image. The shadow is based only on the alpha channel.
        Parameters:
        image - source image. Must be semi-transparent, since its alpha channel is used to make the shadow.
        radius - the size of the shadow, in pixels.
        darkness - how dark to make the shadow, where 0.0 means none and 1.0 is the darkest.
        Returns:
        an image of the same size as the source with just the shadow of it.

      • addReflection

        public static BufferedImage addReflection(BufferedImage image,
                                          double reflectionHeightFraction)
        Return an image with the original and its reflection.
        Parameters:
        image - original image.
        reflectionHeightFraction - the fraction of the original height to make visible in the reflection. 0.2 is a good value here.
        Returns:
        a new image, taller than the original, with the source image on top and the bottom part of the source image reflected at the bottom.

      • blur

        public static BufferedImage blur(BufferedImage image,
                                 double radius)
        Blurs an image using a high-quality high-speed two-pass algorithm. Good stuff about blurring: http://www.jhlabs.com/ip/blurring.html
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        radius - blur radius.
        Returns:
        a blurred version of the source image.

      • rotate

        public static BufferedImage rotate(BufferedImage image,
                                   double radians,
                                   boolean fitNewImage)
        Returns a copy of the image, rotated clockwise by "radians" radians.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        radians - how much to rotate.
        fitNewImage - to make the new image fit the rotate image. Otherwise the new image is the same size and position as the input image.
        Returns:
        a rotated version of the source image.

      • flipVertically

        public static BufferedImage flipVertically(BufferedImage image)
        Returns a copy of the image, flipped vertically.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image, flipped vertically (top to bottom).

      • flipHorizontally

        public static BufferedImage flipHorizontally(BufferedImage image)
        Returns a copy of the image, flipped horizontally.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image, flipped horizontally (left to right).

      • addMargin

        public static BufferedImage addMargin(BufferedImage src,
                                      int top,
                                      int right,
                                      int bottom,
                                      int left,
                                      Color color)
        Adds a margin to the image. The margin will be of the specified color, unless the color, unless the color is null, in which case the margin will be transparent.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        top - number of pixels to add on top.
        right - number of pixels to add on the right.
        bottom - number of pixels to add on the bottom.
        left - number of pixels to add on the left.
        color - color for the margin, or transparent if null.
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image with the specified border.

      • resize

        public static BufferedImage resize(BufferedImage image,
                                   int width,
                                   int height)
        Returns a resized image.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        width - new image width in pixels.
        height - new image height in pixels.
        Returns:
        a resized copy of the source image.

      • scale

        public static BufferedImage scale(BufferedImage image,
                                  double ratio)
        Returns an image scaled by a particular ratio, where 0.5 means half width and half height.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        ratio - ratio of new image size to old image size.
        Returns:
        a resized copy of the source image.

      • resizeToFit

        public static BufferedImage resizeToFit(BufferedImage image,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Returns the image resized to fit in this size but keep the original aspect ratio. Use 0 as either size (but not both) to mean "infinity".
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        width - max width of new image. Use 0 for "infinity".
        height - max height of new image. Use 0 for "infinity".
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image resized to fit in the specified rectangle, keeping the original aspect ratio.

      • shrinkToFit

        public static BufferedImage shrinkToFit(BufferedImage image,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Like resizeToFit() but only shrinks. If the image is smaller, it is returned. Returns the image shrunk to fit in this size but keep the original aspect ratio. Use 0 as either size (but not both) to mean "infinity".
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        width - max width of new image. Use 0 for "infinity".
        height - max height of new image. Use 0 for "infinity".
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image resized to fit in the specified rectangle, keeping the original aspect ratio. If the resized image would be larger, the original image is returned.

      • getTrimmingRectangle

        public static Rectangle getTrimmingRectangle(BufferedImage image)
        Finds the trimming rectangle.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        the rectangle representing the part of the image that's not like the frame (specifically, not like the upper-left corner).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the entire image is the same color.

      • trim

        public static BufferedImage trim(BufferedImage image)
        Removes any constant color around an image. The color is determined by the upper-left pixel. Returns the sub-image, which shares the raster data with the input image.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        a copy of the image with any constant-color border removed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the entire image is a single color.

      • left

        public static BufferedImage left(BufferedImage src,
                                 int pixels)
        Returns the left part of an image.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        pixels - the number of pixels to keep from the left side.
        Returns:
        an image that's a copy of the left side of the source image.

      • right

        public static BufferedImage right(BufferedImage src,
                                  int pixels)
        Returns the right part of an image.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        pixels - the number of pixels to keep from the right side.
        Returns:
        an image that's a copy of the right side of the source image.

      • top

        public static BufferedImage top(BufferedImage src,
                                int pixels)
        Returns the top part of an image.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        pixels - the number of pixels to keep from the top side.
        Returns:
        an image that's a copy of the top side of the source image.

      • bottom

        public static BufferedImage bottom(BufferedImage src,
                                   int pixels)
        Returns the bottom part of an image.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        pixels - the number of pixels to keep from the bottom side.
        Returns:
        an image that's a copy of the bottom side of the source image.

      • crop

        public static BufferedImage crop(BufferedImage src,
                                 int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int width,
                                 int height)
        Returns the part of the image with the upper-left coordinate at x, y and of width and height.
        Parameters:
        src - source image.
        x - x coordinate of top left of the cropping rectangle.
        y - y coordinate of top left of the cropping rectangle.
        width - width of the cropping rectangle.
        height - height of the cropping rectangle.
        Returns:
        a cropped copy of the source image.

      • leftToRight

        public static BufferedImage leftToRight(BufferedImage... layers)
        Concatenates the images left to right. Images are top-aligned, and the background is initialized to black.
        Parameters:
        layers - images to concatenate.
        Returns:
        a new image with all source images concatenated left to right.

      • topToBottom

        public static BufferedImage topToBottom(BufferedImage... layers)
        Concatenates the images top to bottom. Images are left-aligned, and the background is initialized to black.
        Parameters:
        layers - images to concatenate.
        Returns:
        a new image with all source images concatenated top to bottom.

      • pasteAt

        public static BufferedImage pasteAt(BufferedImage bottom,
                                    BufferedImage top,
                                    int x,
                                    int y)
        Returns an image with the top image pasted onto the bottom image at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        bottom - image to draw on the bottom (below the top image).
        top - image to draw on top of the bottom image.
        x - x coordinate (in bottom image) of where to paste the top image.
        y - y coordinate (in bottom image) of where to paste the top image.
        Returns:
        a copy of the bottom image with the top image pasted at x and y.

      • pasteAtWith

        public static BufferedImage pasteAtWith(BufferedImage bottom,
                                        BufferedImage top,
                                        int x,
                                        int y,
                                        BlendingMode blendingMode)
        Returns an image with the top image pasted onto the bottom image at the specified location and with the specified blending mode.
        Parameters:
        bottom - image to draw on the bottom (below the top image).
        top - image to draw on top of the bottom image.
        x - x coordinate (in bottom image) of where to paste the top image.
        y - y coordinate (in bottom image) of where to paste the top image.
        blendingMode - the mode to use for blending the top image. Can be NORMAL or SCREEN.
        Returns:
        a copy of the bottom image with the top image pasted at x and y.

      • toGrayscale

        public static BufferedImage toGrayscale(BufferedImage image)
        Converts a color image to grayscale. Keeps the alpha.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        a copy of the source, but in grayscale.

      • findEdges

        public static BufferedImage findEdges(BufferedImage input)
        Finds the edges (sharp changes) within an image. Copies the input alpha channel, if any.
        Parameters:
        input - source image.
        Returns:
        a grayscale image of the edges of the red channel of the input image.

      • invert

        public static BufferedImage invert(BufferedImage image)
        Returns an inverted images. The alpha mask is untouched, if it's there.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        an inverted copy of the source image (black is white, white is black, etc.).

      • quantize

        public static BufferedImage quantize(BufferedImage image,
                                     int[] values)
        Sets the image to the grayscale value of each pixel snapped to the nearest valid value. Uses the red channel for input. The alpha is untouched.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        values - possible grayscale values (0 to 255) to allow. Must be ordered.
        Returns:
        a grayscale version of the original, with only the allowed values.

      • quantizeTexture

        public static BufferedImage quantizeTexture(BufferedImage image,
                                            int[] values,
                                            BufferedImage[] textures)
        Sets the image to one of the textures specified depending on the value of each pixel snapped to the nearest valid value. The red channel is used for input. The alpha is untouched.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        values - possible grayscale values (0 to 255) to snap the red channel to. Must be ordered.
        textures - textures to use when the red channel of a pixel snaps to a value in in "values". Must be the same length as "values".
        Returns:
        a composite image of the textures, based on the textures.

      • clipToMask

        public static BufferedImage clipToMask(BufferedImage image,
                                       BufferedImage mask)
        Returns an image with the color of the main image (which must be BGR) and the alpha of the mask (which must be ABGR, color is ignored). The two images must be the same size.
        Parameters:
        image - source BGR image.
        mask - source ABGR image for the mask. Its color is ignored.
        Returns:
        the source image masked to the alpha of the mask.

      • grayToTransparent

        public static BufferedImage grayToTransparent(BufferedImage image,
                                              int grayTransparent,
                                              int grayOpaque)
        Returns an semi-transparent image where the transparency was deduced from the color.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        grayTransparent - gray value (0 to 255) to use for fully transparent.
        grayOpaque - gray value (0 to 255) to use for fully opaque.
        Returns:
        a copy of the source image where the transparency is based on the grayscale value of each pixel.

      • interpolateColor

        public static Color interpolateColor(Color c1,
                                     Color c2,
                                     double fraction)
        Interpolates two colors.
        Parameters:
        c1 - one color.
        c2 - the other color.
        fraction - how much of c2 to have. 0.0 means c1 and 1.0 means c2. Values outside the range 0.0 to 1.1 will be clamped at 0 and 255 (possibly causing distortion).
        Returns:
        a color between c1 and c2.

      • makeCheckerboard

        public static BufferedImage makeCheckerboard(int width,
                                             int height,
                                             Color color1,
                                             Color color2,
                                             int squareSize)
        Generate a checkerboard image. The squares are anchored at the upper-left corner of the image.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the generated image
        height - the height of the generated image
        color1 - the color of the square in the upper-left corner
        color2 - the alternating color
        squareSize - the width and height of the checker square
        Returns:
        a checkerboard image.

      • composeOverCheckerboard

        public static BufferedImage composeOverCheckerboard(BufferedImage image)
        Compose the given image over a checkerboard to look for the transparency area.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        Returns:
        the source image over a checkerboard of the same size.

      • load

        public static BufferedImage load(String filename)
                          throws IOException
        Load an image from a filename.
        Parameters:
        filename - the pathname of the image file to load.
        Returns:
        the loaded image.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem loading the image.

      • load

        public static BufferedImage load(InputStream inputStream)
                          throws IOException
        Load an image from an input stream.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the input stream of the image file to load.
        Returns:
        the loaded image.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem loading the image.

      • save

        public static void save(BufferedImage image,
                        String filename)
                 throws IOException
        Saves an image to a filename, auto-detecting the type.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        filename - the pathname to save the file to. The extension is used for the file type. Supports PNG (.png) and JPEG (.jpg or .jpeg) files.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem saving the image.

      • save

        public static void save(BufferedImage image,
                        OutputStream outputStream,
                        String mimeType)
                 throws IOException
        Saves an image to an output stream, auto-detecting the type from the MIME type.
        Parameters:
        image - source image.
        outputStream - the output stream to save the file to.
        mimeType - the type of the image. Use "image/png" for PNG and either "image/jpg" or "image/jpeg" for JPEG.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem saving the image.

      • saveAnimatedGif

        public static void saveAnimatedGif(List<BufferedImage> images,
                                   String filename,
                                   int frameTimeMs,
                                   boolean loop)
                            throws IOException
        Saves a list of images as an animated GIF with the specified pause time for each image and whether to loop continuously. The filename must end with ".gif". Based on code from http://elliot.kroo.net/software/java/GifSequenceWriter/
        Parameters:
        images - source images.
        filename - pathname of GIF to save to.
        frameTimeMs - number of milliseconds to show each frame.
        loop - whether to loop the animation.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem saving the image.

      • getHighQualityRenderingHints

        public static RenderingHints getHighQualityRenderingHints()
        Returns an object setting as many things to high-quality as possible.
        Returns:
        a rendering hints object with high-quality settings.

      • getHighQualityRenderingMap

        public static Map<RenderingHints.Key,Object> getHighQualityRenderingMap()
        Returns a map setting as many things to high-quality as possible.
        Returns:
        a map setting as many things to high-quality as possible.

      • getFont

        public static Font getFont(Typeface typeface,
                           boolean bold,
                           boolean italic,
                           boolean narrow,
                           double size)
                    throws FontFormatException,
                           IOException
        Find a font. The font file must be in the JAR's resources directory.
        Parameters:
        typeface - the typeface of the font.
        bold - whether the font should be bold.
        italic - whether the font should be italic.
        narrow - whether the font should be narrow.
        size - the font size. It's not clear from the Java SDK's documentation what unit this value is.
        Returns:
        a font of the specified typeface and attributes and size.
        Throws:
        FontFormatException - if the file is not of a correct font format.
        IOException - if there's a problem loading the file.

      • getFont

        public static Font getFont(String filename,
                           double size)
                    throws FontFormatException,
                           IOException
        Return a font from the specified filename and size. If the filename is relative, then it will be relative to $HOME/fonts.
        Parameters:
        filename - the pathname to the font file. Must be a TrueType font.
        size - the font size. It's not clear from the Java SDK's documentation what unit this value is.
        Returns:
        the loaded font.
        Throws:
        FontFormatException - if the file is not of a correct font format.
        IOException - if there's a problem loading the file.
